channel.title: Stitches?
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/DHJ00.jpg[/img]
Got attacked again, i seem to be a walking target here, going to go doctors tomorrow if its still bad. Do you think i need stithes? I know your not doctors but a rough guess will do

item.title: Stitches?
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:44, topic:434296”]almost certain switchblades are illegal yes, and it never made a lot of sense to me either - the argument is that they’re quick to ready, but then so are a lot of foldable knives, and we are allowed fixed knives… so… surely theyre the quickest to ready? pretty stupid.

also i should point out its not illegal to own larger knives, but if the cops feel like it theyll ask why youve got it - if you use it for fishing or work or w/e you should only have it on you when doing that, 3" is the largest you can carry everyday for utility/defense

how strict they are on it depends on the cop, i have a friend who carries a pretty big fixed blade “for work purposes”, most of the time he never has any trouble, but once they did call his boss to verify he “was on his way home from work”, but his boss is awesome so that was ok :P[/quote]
change your name to knifeman

Read full topic

item.title: Stitches?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

almost certain switchblades are illegal yes, and it never made a lot of sense to me either - the argument is that they’re quick to ready, but then so are a lot of foldable knives, and we are allowed fixed knives… so… surely theyre the quickest to ready? pretty stupid.

also i should point out its not illegal to own larger knives, but if the cops feel like it theyll ask why youve got it - if you use it for fishing or work or w/e you should only have it on you when doing that, 3" is the largest you can carry everyday for utility/defense

how strict they are on it depends on the cop, i have a friend who carries a pretty big fixed blade “for work purposes”, most of the time he never has any trouble, but once they did call his boss to verify he “was on his way home from work”, but his boss is awesome so that was ok

Read full topic

item.title: Stitches?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:41, topic:434296”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=537015.msg3929577#msg3929577 date=1330553710]

It’s not illegal to carry a little knife here, only up to 3 inches, but i felt like clarifying

Any other rules regarding knifes? Like does it have to be foldable or can it be a fixed blade? What about a lock blade, or a switch blade, or a blade that shoots out of the end? What about ballistic knifes? (knife where the blade can be fired over a distance)

Just curious.
[/quote]Ballistic knives are illegal in most of the world so I’d say its a fair bet they’re a no. Switchblades and any sort of hidden blade is also probably a no. My educated guess would be any folding or fixed blade less than 3 inches in length.

I find it funny that, even here, where I have a concealed carry permit to carry a gun with me, that ballistic knives and switchblades are still illegal. Outdated laws that need changing from the time when no weapons were legal for law-abiding citizens and crime was rampant.

when the fuck were guns/weapons ever illegal in america?[/quote]
Lots of weapons have been illegal over the years, like the knives I mentioned. Also, I meant when no weapons were legal for law-abiding citizens to carry, at least in my state of Ohio.

In some states/localities, guns are still ‘illegal’ for a law-abiding citizen to own. Illinois, New York, and California are some of the worst culprits, by the letter of the law you can own a gun there (but not carry it!), but in practice you have to apply for permits and wait a very long time and generally can’t get what you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Stitches?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Hed have to pull it out as they were walking towards him though

I like how in America you usually

A. Get robbed, refuse, robber just runs away because hes wasting time
B. Get robbed, let them rob you, the robbers run away
C. Get beat up and then they run.

Seems like you get all 3 in london

Getting arrested for robbery with a gun is about 4x the charge of robbing someone with a knife/fist

Read full topic

item.title: Stitches?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:22, topic:434296”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=537015.msg3927351#msg3927351 date=1330363347]
… Despite the growing controversy, a study funded by the U.S. Justice Department asserted that the …

So the next thing we have to do is outlaw fists too right and have everyones arms amputated, because if I beat a person to death with my fists or snap their neck then obviously I am carrying a weapon and it needs to be outlawed
[/quote]
Q: Are fists mainly a weapon?
A: No.

Q: Are tazzers mainly a weapon?
A: Yes.

Q: See the difference?[/quote]
Assault is assault.

Read full topic

item.title: Stitches?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:12, topic:434296”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taser_safety_issues#Deaths_and_injuries_related_to_Taser_use
Tazzers are only safe if you don’t use them, there is no safe and non-safe usage.[/quote]

Despite the growing controversy, a study funded by the U.S. Justice Department asserted that the majority of people tasered from July 2005 to June 2007 suffered no injury. A study led by William Bozeman, of the Wake Forest University Baptist Medical Center, of nearly 1,000 persons subjected to Taser use, concluded that 99.7% of the cases had either minor injuries, such as scrapes and bruises, or none at all; while three persons suffered injuries severe enough to need hospital admission, two of them resulting in death. Their autopsy reports indicated neither death was related to the use of a Taser.

So the next thing we have to do is outlaw fists too right and have everyones arms amputated, because if I beat a person to death with my fists or snap their neck then obviously I am carrying a weapon and it needs to be outlawed

Read full topic
